subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
An unorthodox variant {{Han simp|慍|f=𥁕|t=昷|nocap=y}} which can be found in the historical {{w|Longkan Shoujian}} ({{w2|zh|龍龕手鑑}}) dictionary compiled in 997 AD.

Eventually adopted as an official form by the People's Republic of China in 1965 based on the {{w|Xin Zixing}} ({{w2|zh|新字形}}) standardized form of characters.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This character is also the preferred form used in Hong Kong, where traditional Chinese is used. <!-- Refer HKSCS 2016 (Table 2) and http://input.foruto.com/ccc/gongbiu/dzijingbiu/ -->
